NYC Mesh

A community-owned
resilient network.

New Node Request

What is a Mesh

The mesh network consists of WiFi router "nodes" spread across the city. A mesh network has no central server and no single internet service provider. All nodes cooperate in the distribution of data, serving as a stand-alone network in case of emergencies.

What We Do

We aim to create a free, resilient, stand-alone communication system that serves both for daily use and also for emergencies—be it power outages or internet disruption—running software that helps our community with hyperlocal maps and events.

Get Involved

  • Install Node

    We're always hungry for new nodes, so if you are located in the NY/NJ areas and have rooftop access do let us know.

    It's all about installing a router for less than $100. We install and configure it for you.

    There are no monthly fees and you'll help us grow.

    Request New Node

  • Weekly Meetings

    We have regular meetings in downtown Manhattan, plus occasional weekly meetings with other related organizations.

    Join us on Meetup

    Newsletter

    Be informed of our progress via email.

    Join our Newsletter

  • Donate

    NYC Mesh is a labor of love and all members are unpaid volunteers, but we're always in need of new hardware.

    If you can afford to help, please do!

    Visit our Wish List Donate via Bitcoin

    We're always posting new tutorials.
